{"step_by_step_thinking": "The boy has received his complete primary immunization and a booster of DT, which includes protection against tetanus. Therefore, he does not need an injection of TT (Tetanus Toxoid) as he is already immunized. Injection of human antiserum is used for passive immunization in case of exposure to certain diseases, but it's not necessary in this case as the boy is already immunized. Broad spectrum antibiotics can be used to prevent or treat any potential bacterial infection from the contaminated wound. Wound debridement and cleaning is necessary to remove any foreign material and reduce the risk of infection.", "answer_choice": "B. Injection of human antiserum"}
